page.title: 12LOWESWATER FARMS
page.content: Farms are privately owned except 2 held by the N.T. 5 are let on an annual agricultural tenancy. Picket How is owner occupied. Fodder crops grown are silage, hay, some barley & turnips. Small amounts of foods are bought in. As well as sheep, suckler beef herds are kept at Godferhead and High Cross. Calves reared are sold at 8-12 months. Dairy farming is carried out at Godferhead & Pickett How, Friesans being the main breed. Milk produced is collected daily by M.M.B. tankers. Crossbred calves from beef bulls are sold, as followers aren't kept.Auction markets used: Penrith, Cockermouth, Troutbeck and Carlisle. Farmers use no hired labour except for silage and shearing contractors. Field boundaries are mainly dry stone walls, but fell enclosures of post & wire are now superseding walls.
